bibl.title: [Wild Pigeon Killed From Flock Near Papillion].
Omaha Sunday Bee
bibl.author: Griswold, Sandy, Sporting Editor.

div.head: Wild Pigeon Killed From Flock Near Papillion
div.p: Edgar Howard, editor of the Papillion Times, and Sarpy's newly-elected county judge, is an ardent follower of field sports. Mr. Howard was down in Hahn's woods, five miles southeast of the town, Saturday last, and killed nine squirrels and a wild pigeon with a 22 Winchester. The killing of the pigeon is a rare event, indeed, and with one exception is the only bird of this kind that has been bagged in this section of the country for ten years or more. There were from fifteen to twenty birds in the flock Mr. Howard saw. They were in the dense Umber, which is heavier here than at any other part of the county, and he got but one shot. The bird was a handsome old cock, with beautiful long tail feathers and royal purple bronze breast.

cit.bibl: Sandy Griswold, Sporting Editor. November 17, 1895. [Wild Pigeon Killed From Flock Near Papillion.] Omaha Sunday Bee p. 22.
